intro: Encelia californica, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its vibrant orange to red flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its showy, composite flower heads. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and coastal dunes. Encelia californica is an annual herb that thrives in full sun and well-drained soils.
